decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [Unnumbered Location Plan], Received: 27/09/2024, [100_00 Rev X], [100_01 Rev X], [100_02 Rev X], [100_06 Rev X], [100_07 Rev X], [100_08 Rev X], [100_09 Rev X], [100_0.1 Rev A], [100_03 Rev A], [100_04 Rev A], [100_05 Rev A], [100_10 Rev A], [100_11 Rev A], [100_13 Rev A], [100_31 Rev X], Received: 22/11/2024, [100_13 Rev A], Received: 03/01/2025.
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows or openings shall be formed in the side elevations of the development hereby permitted.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' privacy.

Condition : 5 - Parking area
Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, full details of the forecourt layout (showing no more than one vehicular parking space), front boundary treatment and hard and soft landscaping within the forecourt of the proposed development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
The approved details shall indicate the positions, heights, design, materials and type of the hard and soft landscaping features and boundary treatment to be erected, and shall be erected in accordance with the approved scheme and shall be retained as such thereafter. 
Reason: In order to minimise danger, obstruction and inconvenience to users of the highway and of the access and to avoid harm to the appearance of the area.
description: Conversion of chalet bungalow into a two story property with a two-storey side extension following the demolition of the garage, rear dormer with a Juliette balcony and additional side windows.
